1.Comment: Used in addition to the other Rushing stats so that total minus rushing yards can be calculated.
1.Name: Rushing Yards - Minus

2.Comment: Punt was blocked.  A blocked punt is a punt that is touched behind the line of scrimmage, and is recovered, or goes out of bounds, behind the line of scrimmage. If the impetus of the punt takes it beyond the line of scrimmage, it is not a "blocked punt."
2.Name: Punt Blocked (Offense)

3.Comment: A first down or TD occurred due to a rush.
3.Name: 1st Down Rushing

4.Comment: A first down or TD occurred due to a pass.
4.Name: 1st Down Passing

5.Comment: A first down or TD occurred due to a penalty.
5.Name: 1st Down Penalty

6.Comment: 3rd down play resulted in a first down or touchdown.
6.Name: 3rd Down Attempt Converted

7.Comment: 3rd down play did NOT result in a first down or touchdown.
7.Name: 3rd Down Attempt Failed

8.Comment: 4th down play resulted in a first down or touchdown
8.Name: 4th Down Attempt Converted

9.Comment: 4th down play did NOT result in a first down or touchdown.
9.Name: 4th Down Attempt Failed

10.Comment: Rushing yards and credit for a rushing attempt.
10.Name: Rushing Yards

11.Comment: Rushing yards and credit for a rushing attempt where the result of the play was a touchdown.
11.Name: Rushing Yards, TD

12.Comment: Rushing yards with NO rushing attempt. This will occur when the initial runner laterals to a second runner, and the second runner possesses the lateral beyond the line of scrimmage. Both players get rushing yards, but only the 1st player gets a rushing attempt. The rule is that the last player to possess the ball behind the line of scrimmage gets the rushing attempt.
12.Name: Rushing Yards, No Rush

13.Comment: Rushing yards and NO rushing attempt, where the result of the play was a touchdown.
13.Name: Rushing Yards, TD, No Rush

15.Comment: Passing yards and a pass attempt completed.
15.Name: Passing Yards

16.Comment: Passing yards and a pass attempt completed that resulted in a touchdown.
16.Name: Passing Yards, TD

17.Comment: In SuperStat, this code was used when the initial pass receiver lateraled to a teammate.  It was later combined with the "Passing Yards" code to determine the passer's (quaterback's) total passing yardage on the play. IN OUR SYSTEM, THIS CODE SHOULD NOT BE NECESSARY.
17.Name: Passing Yards, No Pass

18.Comment: Passing yards, no pass attempt, with a result of touchdown. (See previous code.) THIS CODE SHOULD NOT BE NECESSARY IN OUR SYSTEM.
18.Name: Passing Yards, TD, No Pass

19.Comment: Pass attempt that resulted in an interception.
19.Name: Interception (by Passer)

20.Comment: Number of yards lost on a pass play that resulted in a sack.
20.Name: Sack Yards (Offense)

22.Comment: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.
22.Name: Pass Reception Yards, TD

23.Comment: Pass reception yards, no pass reception. This will occur when the pass receiver laterals to a teammate. The teammate gets pass reception yards, but no credit for a pass reception.
23.Name: Pass Reception Yards, No Reception

24.Comment: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.
24.Name: Pass Reception Yards, TD, No Reception

26.Comment: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.
26.Name: Interception Yards, TD

27.Comment: Interception yards, with NO credit for an interception. This will occur when the player who intercepted the pass laterals to a teammate. The teammate gets interception return yards, but no credit for a pass interception.
27.Name: Interception Yards, No Interception

28.Comment: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.
28.Name: Interception Yards, TD, No Interception

29.Comment: Punt and length of the punt.
29.Name: Punting Yards

30.Comment: This stat is recorded when the punt RETURN ended inside the opponents 20 yard line. This is not counted as a punt or towards punting yards. This stat is used solely to calculate "inside 20" stats. This stat is used in addition to either a PU or PU_EZ stat.
30.Name: Punt Inside 20

31.Comment: SuperStat records this stat when the punt is received in the end-zone, and then run out of the end-zone. If the play ends in the end-zone for a touchback, the stat is not recorded.
31.Name: Punt Into End Zone

32.Comment: Punt and length of the punt when the play results in a touchback.
32.Name: Punt With Touchback

34.Comment: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.
34.Name: Punt Return Yards, TD

35.Comment: Punt return yards with no credit for a punt return. This will occur when the player who received the punt laterals to a teammate. The teammate gets punt return yards, but no credit for a return.
35.Name: Punt Return Yards, No Return

36.Comment: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.
36.Name: Punt Return Yards, TD, No Return

37.Comment: Punt went out of bounds, no return on the play.
37.Name: Punt Out Of Bounds

38.Comment: Punt was downed by kicking team, no return on the play.
38.Name: Punt Downed (No Return)

39.Comment: Punt resulted in a fair catch.
39.Name: Punt - Fair Catch

40.Comment: Punt resulted in a touchback. This is the receiving teams version of code 1504/28 above. Both are needed for stat calculations, especially in season cumulative analysis.
40.Name: Punt - Touchback (No Return)

42.Comment: Kickoff and length of kick, where return ended inside the opponents 20 yard line. This is not counted as a kick or towards kicking yards. This code is used solely to calculate "inside 20" stats. Used in addition to a 1701 code.
42.Name: Kickoff Inside 20

43.Comment: SuperStat records this stat when the kickoff is received in the end-zone, and then run out of the end-zone. If the play ends in the end-zone for a touchback, the stat is not recorded.
43.Name: Kickoff Into End Zone

46.Comment: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.
46.Name: Kickoff Return Yards, TD

47.Comment: Kickoff yards with no return. This will occur when the player who is credited with the return laterals to a teammate. The teammate gets kickoff return yards, but no credit for a kickoff return.
47.Name: Kickoff Return Yards, No Return

48.Comment: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.
48.Name: Kickoff Return Yards, TD, No Return

49.Comment: Kicked ball went out of bounds.
49.Name: Kickoff Out Of Bounds

50.Comment: Kick resulted in a fair catch (no return).
50.Name: Kickoff - Fair Catch

51.Comment: Kick resulted in a touchback.  A touchback implies that there is no return.
51.Name: Kickoff - Touchback

52.Comment: Player fumbled the ball, fumble was not forced by another player.
52.Name: Fumble - Forced

53.Comment: Player fumbled the ball, fumble was forced by another player.
53.Name: Fumble - Not Forced

54.Comment: Player fumbled the ball, and the ball went out of bounds.
54.Name: Fumble - Out Of Bounds

55.Comment: Yardage gained/lost by a player after he recovered a fumble by his own team.
55.Name: Own Recovery Yards

56.Comment: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.
56.Name: Own Recovery Yards, TD

57.Comment: If a player recovered a fumble by his own team, then lateraled to a teammate, the yardage gained/lost by the teammate would be recorded with this stat.
57.Name: Own Recovery Yards, No Recovery

58.Comment: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.
58.Name: Own Recovery Yards, TD, No Recovery

59.Comment: Yardage gained/lost by a player after he recovered a fumble by the opposing team.
59.Name: Opponent Recovery Yards

60.Comment: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.
60.Name: Opponent Recovery Yards, TD

61.Comment: If a player recovered a fumble by the opposing team, then lateraled to a teammate, the yardage gained/lost by the teammate would be recorded with this stat.
61.Name: Opponent Recovery Yards, No Recovery

62.Comment: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.
62.Name: Opponent Recovery Yards, TD, No Recovery

63.Comment: This is sort of a catch-all for yardage that doesn't fall into any other category.  According to Elias, It does not include loose ball yardage.  Examples are yardage on missed field goal, blocked punt. This stat is not used to "balance the books." No such accounting occurs.
63.Name: Miscellaneous Yards

64.Comment: Same as previous, except when the play results in a touchdown.
64.Name: Miscellaneous Yards, TD

69.Comment: The length of a missed field goal.
69.Name: Field Goal Missed Yards

70.Comment: The length of a successful field goal.
70.Name: Field Goal Yards

71.Comment: The length of an attempted field goal that was blocked.
71.Name: Field Goal Blocked (Offense)

72.Comment: Extra Point Good.  SuperStat uses one code for both successful and unsuccessful extra points. I think it might be better to use 2 codes.
72.Name: Extra Point - Good

74.Comment: Extra Point Blocked.  Exclusive of the extra point failed stat.
74.Name: Extra Point - Blocked

75.Comment: Extra Points By Run Good (old version has 0/1 in yards for failed/good)
75.Name: 2 Point Rush - Good

77.Comment: Extra Points By Pass Good (old version has 0/1 in yards for failed/good)
77.Name: 2 Point Pass - Good

80.Comment: Tackle with one or more assists.
80.Name: Assisted Tackle

81.Comment: Tackle split equally between two players.
81.Name: 1/2 Tackle

84.Comment: Sack split equally between two players.
84.Name: 1/2 Sack Yards (Defense)

85.Comment: Incomplete pass was due primarily to the players action.
85.Name: Pass Defensed

89.Comment: Tackle that resulted in a safety. This is in addition to a tackle (code 5001).
89.Name: Safety (Defense)

90.Comment: This stat was used by SuperStat when a 1/2 Tackle resulted in a safety. This was in addition to a 1/2 tackle code.
90.Name: 1/2 Safety (Defense)

95.Comment: Tackled for a Loss (TFL) is an OFFENSIVE stat.
95.Name: Tackled for a Loss

96.Comment: If there is a fumble on an extra point attempt, and the loose ball goes into the endzone from impetus provided by the defensive team, and becomes dead in the endzone, the offense is awarded 1 point.
96.Name: Extra Point - Safety

103.Comment: This stat will be used when the Passer fumbles, then recovers, then laterals. The receiver of the lateral gets sack yardage but no sack.
103.Name: Sack Yards (Offense), No Sack

107.Comment: Direct recovery of own kickoff, whether or not the kickoff is onside.
107.Name: Own Kickoff Recovery

108.Comment: Direct recovery in end zone of own kickoff, whether or not the kickoff is onside.
108.Name: Own Kickoff Recovery, TD

110.Comment: Player knocked the quarterback to the ground, quarterback was not the ball carrier.
110.Name: Quarterback Hit

111.Comment: Length of the pass, not including the yards gained by the receiver after the catch. Unofficial stat.
111.Name: Pass Length, Completion

112.Comment: Length of the pass if it would have been a completion. Unofficial stat.
112.Name: Pass Length, No Completion

113.Comment: Yardage from where the ball was caught until the player's action was over. Unofficial stat.
113.Name: Yardage Gained After the Catch

115.Comment: Player was the target of a pass attempt.
115.Name: Pass Target

120.Comment: Player tackled the runner behind the line of scrimmage. Play must have ended, player must have received a tackle stat, has to be an offensive player tackled.
120.Name: Tackle for a Loss

201.Comment: (NFL Europe) The length of a successful LONG field goal.
201.Name: Long Field Goal Yards

211.Comment: (NFL Europe) 2 points scored by defense on extra point(s) attempt.
211.Name: Extra Point - Deuce

401.Comment: (NCAA) Player split credit for a tackle for a loss with another player.
401.Name: 1/2 Tackle for a Loss

402.Comment: Yardage from line of scrimmage to where TFL was earned. Note: NCAA TFLs differ from NFL TFLs, not necessarily the yardage lost by the offense.
402.Name: Tackle for a Loss Yardage

403.Comment: Defender intercepted or recovered an offensive fumble or (NFL only, recovered a blocked kick) during a two point conversion try.
403.Name: Defensive Two Point Attempts

404.Comment: Defender intercepted or recovered an offensive fumble or (NFL only, recovered a blocked kick) during a two point conversion try and returned the ball for two defensive extra points.
404.Name: Defensive Two Point Conversions

405.Comment: (NCAA) Defender recovered a blocked extra point try.
405.Name: Defensive Extra Point Attempts

406.Comment: (NCAA) Defender recovered a blocked extra point try and returned the ball for two defensive extra points.
406.Name: Defensive Extra Point Conversions

410.Comment: Kickoff and length of kick. Includes end zone yards for all kicks into the end zone, including kickoffs ending in a touchback.
410.Name: Kickoff Length

420.Comment: Defensive fumble recovered or pass intercepted by kicking team and returned for two points for the kicking team.
420.Name: 2 Point Return - Good
